longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the creation of enduring powers of attorney and matters related thereto.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Enduring Powers of Attorney Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: attorney (受權人), in relation to an enduring power, means the person appointed as attorney under the power;
court (法院) means the Court of First Instance; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)
donor (授權人), in relation to an enduring power, means the person giving the power;
enduring power (持久授權) means an enduring power of attorney;
enduring power of attorney (持久授權書) means a power of attorney which is an enduring power of attorney within the meaning of section 3;

mentally incapable (精神上無能力行事) and mental incapacity (精神上無行為能力) mean being mentally incapable and suffering from mental incapacity within the meaning of section 1A of the Powers of Attorney Ordinance (Cap. 31) and mentally capable (精神上有能力行事) and mental capacity (精神上行為能力) must be construed accordingly;
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 18;
prescribed explanatory information (訂明說明資料) means the information prescribed under section 18 (which is described in subsection (2) of that section);
registered (註冊) means registered under section 9;
trust corporation (信託法團) has the meaning assigned to it by the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt it is declared that for the purposes of this Ordinance the references to “power of attorney” and “effect of the power of attorney” in section 1A of the Powers of Attorney Ordinance (Cap. 31) are to be construed as references respectively to “enduring power” and “effect of the enduring power and the prescribed explanatory information in the enduring power”.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Characteristics of an enduring power

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a power of attorney is an enduring power of attorney if the instrument which creates the power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the prescribed form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was executed in the prescribed manner by the donor and the attorney; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contained at the time of execution by the donor the prescribed explanatory information.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an instrument in the prescribed form purporting to have been executed in the prescribed manner shall be taken, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be a document which incorporated at the time of execution by the donor the prescribed explanatory information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the instrument differs in any respect which is not material in form or mode of expression from that prescribed, it shall be treated as being in the prescribed form.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt it is declared that an instrument which purports to create an enduring power but does not comply with this section cannot take effect as an enduring power.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Enduring power to survive mental incapacity of donor

subsection.content: Subject to this section, where an individual creates an enduring power, the power is not revoked by reason of any subsequent mental incapacity of the donor.
If the attorney has reason to believe that the donor is or is becoming mentally incapable he must, as soon as practicable, apply under section 9 for registration of the instrument creating the power.
In the event of the subsequent mental incapacity of the donor, the attorney shall not do anything under the authority of the power unless or until it is registered.

So long as the authority of the attorney to act under the power is suspended by the operation of subsection (3), section 5 of the Powers of Attorney Ordinance (Cap. 31) shall apply (so far as applicable) as if the power had been revoked by the donor’s mental incapacity.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsections (3) and (4), where the attorney has applied for registration of the instrument, he may, pending such registration, act under the enduring power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to maintain the donor or prevent loss to his estate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to maintain himself or other persons in so far as section 8(3)(b) permits him to do so.

subsection.content: Where the attorney purports to act under subsection (5), then, in favour of any person who deals with him without knowledge that the attorney is acting otherwise than in accordance with paragraph (a) or (b) of that subsection, the transaction between them is valid as if the attorney were acting in accordance with that paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Mental capacity and formalities for execution of enduring power

subsection.content: The mental capacity required for the creation of an enduring power is mental capacity within the meaning of section 2.

subsection.leadIn: In executing an enduring power, the following must be complied with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the donor must sign the instrument creating the enduring power before a registered medical practitioner and a solicitor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the instrument must be signed by the donor before the solicitor either at the same time when it is signed before the registered medical practitioner or at any time after that signing but before the expiry of the period of 28 days after the day on which it is so signed; (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the registered medical practitioner and the solicitor before whom the instrument is signed must each be a person other than the person being appointed as the attorney, the spouse of such person or a person related by blood or marriage to the donor or the attorney; (Added 25 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the donor is physically incapable of signing, any other person, not being the attorney, the spouse of the attorney, the registered medical practitioner or the solicitor before whom the instrument is signed or the spouse of the registered medical practitioner or the solicitor, may sign the instrument on behalf of the donor in the presence, and under the direction, of the donor; (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the attorney must sign the instrument; (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the donor appeared to be mentally capable (specifying in the certification that the donor appeared to be mentally capable in terms of section 2); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the instrument was signed in the presence of the solicitor and, if it is signed by the donor, that the donor acknowledged that it was signed voluntarily and, if it is signed on the donor’s behalf, that it was so signed in the presence, and under the direction, of the donor; and (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the registered medical practitioner was satisfied that the donor was mentally capable (specifying in the certification that the registered medical practitioner was satisfied that the donor was mentally capable in terms of section 2); and (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the instrument was signed in the presence of the registered medical practitioner and, if it is signed by the donor, that the donor acknowledged that it was signed voluntarily and, if it is signed on the donor’s behalf, that it was so signed in the presence, and under the direction, of the donor. (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 3)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Restrictions on being an attorney
section.leadIn: A power of attorney cannot be an enduring power unless when he executes the instrument creating it, the attorney—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an individual who has attained the age of 18 years and is not bankrupt or mentally incapable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a trust corporation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Instruments which cannot be enduring powers

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: empowers the attorney to appoint another person in substitution for himself or as his successor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: empowers the attorney to delegate trusts for the purposes of section 27 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29),

section.name: s8
section.heading: Scope of authority, etc. of attorney under enduring power

subsection.leadIn: An enduring power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not confer on the attorney any authority other than authority to act in relation to the property of the donor and his financial affairs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (a), must specify, in accordance with regulations made under section 18, the particular matters, property or affairs in relation to which the attorney has authority to act.

subsection.content: An instrument which purports to create an enduring power which does not comply with subsection (1) cannot take effect as an enduring power.

subsection.leadIn: An attorney may, subject to any conditions and restrictions contained in the enduring power and without obtaining any consent—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: act under the power so as to benefit himself and other persons (not being the donor) to the following extent, but no further—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he may so act in relation to himself or in relation to any other person if the donor might be expected to provide for his or that person’s needs respectively; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he may do whatever the donor might be expected to do to meet those needs; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to paragraph (b) and subject to subsection (4), dispose of the property of the donor by way of gift to the following extent, but no further—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he may make gifts of a seasonal nature or at a time or on an anniversary of a birth or marriage to persons (including himself) who are related to or connected with the donor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he may make gifts to any charity to which the donor made or might be expected to make gifts.

subsection.content: A gift under subsection (3)(c) must not be unreasonable having regard to all the circumstances, in particular, the donor’s estate.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Registration and inspection of enduring power

subsection.content: An application to register, for the purposes of section 4(2), an instrument creating an enduring power must be made to the Registrar of the High Court. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

Where an application is made under subsection (1), the Registrar shall register the instrument concerned, if he is satisfied that the instrument purports to create an enduring power, the requirements in this Ordinance or in any rules relating to the registration of such an instrument have been complied with and the fee payable for such registration has been paid.
The original and a certified copy of any instrument registered under this section must be lodged with the Registrar.
The Registrar shall keep a register of instruments which are registered under this section, in a form approved by the Chief Justice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the register kept under subsection (4); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any instrument registered under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow any person to inspect the register and the instruments during office hours and obtain copies thereof (sealed or otherwise) on payment of the fee payable therefor.

subsection.content: The power to make rules under section 54 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) includes a power to make rules of court (including rules specifying fees) for the purposes of this section. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt it is declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this section shall not be construed as requiring the Registrar to determine the validity of an instrument for the registration of which an application is made under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registration does not validate an enduring power which is invalid.

editorialNote.content: Please see the Enduring Powers of Attorney (Registration) Rules (Cap. 4 sub. leg. E).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Commencement

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4(3), an enduring power commences— (Amended 25 of 2011 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a date or an event is specified in the instrument creating it, for its commencement, on that date or the happening of that event; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no such date or event is specified, on its execution.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, an enduring power does not commence as a power of attorney before it is executed. (Added 25 of 2011 s. 4)
For the purposes of subsections (1)(b) and (2), an enduring power is executed when it is duly signed before the solicitor in compliance with the requirements in section 5. (Added 25 of 2011 s. 4)
Subsections (2) and (3) do not affect any enduring power executed before the commencement date* of the Enduring Powers of Attorney (Amendment) Ordinance 2011 (25 of 2011). (Added 25 of 2011 s. 4)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Functions of court in relation to enduring power

subsection.leadIn: The court may on the application of an interested party—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the attorney under an enduring power to produce records and accounts and make an order for their auditing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke an enduring power or vary an enduring power; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if satisfied that the interests of the donor of an enduring power so require it, remove the attorney.

subsection.content: The attorney under an enduring power may apply to the court for directions on the meaning and scope of the authority of the power.

The court may relieve the attorney under an enduring power wholly or partly from any liability which he has or may have incurred on account of a breach of his duties as attorney, if it appears to the court that the attorney has acted honestly and reasonably.

subsection.leadIn: The court shall cancel the registration of an instrument creating an enduring power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the enduring power has expired or is revoked under section 13;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where the attorney is removed under subsection (1)(c).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Attorney’s duties and liabilities

subsection.content: The attorney’s duties towards the donor of an enduring power are of a fiduciary nature.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the attorney under an enduring power has a duty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to exercise his powers honestly and with due diligence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to keep proper accounts and records;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not to enter into any transaction where a conflict of interest would arise with the donor; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not to mix the property of the donor with other property.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Revocation of enduring power

subsection.leadIn: An enduring power is revoked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the donor revokes it when he is mentally capable, or where the donor becomes mentally incapable after the grant and the instrument is registered, if the donor revokes it after his recovery and the court makes an order under subsection (2) confirming the revocation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the bankruptcy of the attorney;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a court makes an order for its revocation under section 11(1)(b) or for the removal of an attorney under section 11(1)(c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: on the appointment of a committee pursuant to Part II of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), if the court gives a direction revoking the enduring power;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: on the death of the donor or the attorney; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: subject to this Ordinance, on any ground on which a power of attorney is revoked at common law.

subsection.content: Where the enduring power is registered, on application made for the purpose, by or on behalf of the donor, the court shall confirm the revocation of the power if satisfied that the donor has done whatever is necessary in law to effect an express revocation of the power and was mentally capable of revoking a power of attorney when he did so.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Protection where instrument does not create valid enduring power and the power has been revoked by donor’s mental incapacity

subsection.leadIn: The following applies where an instrument is framed in the prescribed form but does not create a valid enduring power (but creates a power of attorney) and the power is revoked by the donor’s supervening mental incapacity (whether or not the instrument has been registered)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an attorney who acts under the power does not by reason of the revocation incur any liability (either to the donor or to any other person) unless at the time of so acting he knew—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the instrument did not create a valid enduring power; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the donor has become mentally incapable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any transaction between the attorney and any other person, in favour of that person, is as valid as if the power had then been in existence, unless at the time of the transaction that person knew—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the instrument did not create a valid enduring power; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the donor has become mentally incapable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the interest of a particular purchaser depends on whether a transaction between the attorney and any other person was valid by virtue of paragraph (b), it shall be conclusively presumed in favour of the purchaser that the transaction was valid if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the transaction between that person and the attorney was completed within 12 months of the date on which the instrument came into operation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that person makes a statutory declaration, before or within 3 months after the completion of the purchase, that he had no reason at the time of the transaction to doubt that the attorney had authority to dispose of the property which was the subject of the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: The following applies for the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: purchaser (購買人) has the meaning assigned to it by section 5(6) of the Powers of Attorney Ordinance (Cap. 31);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 5(8) of the Powers of Attorney Ordinance (Cap. 31) applies to and in relation to any reference to statutory declaration.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Appointment of joint and several attorneys

subsection.content: An instrument which appoints more than one attorney cannot create an enduring power unless the attorneys are appointed to act jointly or jointly and severally.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of this Ordinance apply to joint attorneys subject to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference in section 6(a) to the time of the execution of the instrument by the attorney must be read as a reference to the time when the second or last attorney executed the instrument;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to the attorney in sections 7(a) and 13(1)(b) and (f) must be read as a reference to any attorney under the power.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of this Ordinance apply to joint and several attorneys subject to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a failure as respects one attorney to comply with the requirements of the creation of the power operates to prevent the instrument from creating such a power in relation to him, but does not affect its efficacy for that purpose as respects the other or other attorneys in relation to whom those requirements have been complied with or its efficacy for the purpose of creating a power of attorney which is not an enduring power;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument may be registered by any one of the attorneys;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reference to the death of the attorney in section 13(1)(f) must be construed as a reference to the last of the remaining attorneys under the power;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reference to the bankruptcy of the attorney in that section must be construed as a reference to the bankruptcy of the last remaining attorney under the power; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other attorney who becomes bankrupt ceases to be an attorney on his bankruptcy.

section.name: s16
section.heading: No waiver of requirements of Ordinance
section.content: A waiver of the requirements of this Ordinance pursuant to an agreement or otherwise is not valid.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Protection against disclaimer by attorney
section.leadIn: The following applies in relation to the disclaimer by the attorney under an enduring power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the donor is mentally incapable or where the enduring power is registered, a disclaimer by the attorney does not revoke the power unless on application made for that purpose by the attorney, the court confirms that the power is revoked by the disclaimer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the court may confirm, under paragraph (a), that a power is revoked by a disclaimer where it is satisfied that the attorney has done whatever is necessary in law to effect a revocation of a power of attorney by a disclaimer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the donor is mentally capable and the instrument creating the enduring power is not registered, a disclaimer by the attorney has the same effect as a disclaimer has in relation to a power of attorney at common law.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.content: The Secretary for Justice may make regulations as regards the form, manner of execution and other matters relating to the creation of an enduring power. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting the generality of subsection (1), regulations made under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide that an instrument does not create an enduring power unless it contains such information, as may be prescribed, explaining the effect of creating an enduring power and the effect of accepting such a power;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (b), specify a list of powers, decisions or other matters with reference to which the attorney is to be given authority to act.

subsection.content: The prescribed form for the instrument creating an enduring power of attorney may provide for the donor to nominate the persons (whose number must not exceed the number specified in the form) to be notified by the attorney before the attorney applies for the registration of the instrument under section 9. (Replaced 25 of 2011 s. 5)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Effect of failure to notify persons nominated by donor
section.leadIn: Where provision is made under section 18(3) for nomination of persons for the purpose of notification and the donor of an enduring power makes such a nomination, the failure (for whatever reason) by the attorney to notify any person so nominated has the following effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it does not preclude the registration of the instrument creating the enduring power;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the enduring power is not invalidated by reason of such failure; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any legal proceedings relating to the enduring power, where it considers it appropriate, the court may draw an adverse inference from such failure.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Transitional and savings for repeal of section 8(3)(a)

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the repealed section 8(3)(a) continues to apply to an enduring power of attorney created before the commencement date (pre-existing PA) and is in force on that date for a period of one year from the commencement date as if that section had not been repealed.

If the instrument creating a pre-existing PA is registered as at the commencement date, the repealed section 8(3)(a) ceases to apply to the pre-existing PA when the registration of the instrument is cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: If an application for the registration of an instrument creating a pre-existing PA is pending as at the commencement date, or is made during the period of one year from that date, then the repealed section 8(3)(a) ceases to apply to the pre-existing PA—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the instrument is registered pursuant to the application, whether during or after that one-year period, when the registration of the instrument is cancelled; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is finally refused by the Registrar of the High Court or withdrawn by the applicant or otherwise finally disposed of, whether during or after that one-year period, when the application is finally refused, withdrawn or otherwise finally disposed of.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: cancelled (被取消) means cancelled under section 11(4);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 57 of the Trust Law (Amendment) Ordinance 2013 (13 of 2013) comes into operation.
